DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Bevacizumab Protocol Treatment Arm Assignment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was assignment to the specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial to bevacizumab, a monoclonal antibody that may prevent the growth of blood vessels from surrounding tissue to a solid tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Bevacizumab Protocol Treatment Arm Assignment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assignment the specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial to bevacizumab, a monoclonal antibody that may prevent the growth of blood vessels from surrounding tissue to a solid tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A monoclonal antibody that may prevent the growth of blood vessels from surrounding tissue to a solid tumor.:A specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial.:Assignment; an undertaking that you have been assigned to do.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine.  Bevacizumab binds to VEGF and inhibits VEGF receptor binding, thereby preventing the growth and maintenance of tumor blood vessels.
A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.
An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
